_header: While Fortune thee favoreth friends thou hast plenty
Subjects: friends, fickleness of; Fortune, fickleness of; mutability; transitoriness, of world
_description: Warning that friends are as fickle as fortune — one six-line stanza (ababcc)

DULCosViii9.First Lines:
While fortune the favorethe frendes thow hast plentyeThe tyme being
                    troublous thow arte all alone…
DULCosViii9.Last Lines:
…In emptie barnes where faylethe substaunceHappenethe no
                    frende in whome is assuraunce
DULCosViii9.Attributed Title: Omelius de Ponto (f. 64v, to left of text)
